intro: Guepinia iberis, commonly known as the Iberian guepinia, is a flowering plant species native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Capparaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive floral structures. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its small, yellow flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, adding visual interest to its compact form. Guepinia iberis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local insect populations.
